div.pre: 313 Larissa, Thessaly, c. 1954 or earlier Burial: late 2nd cent. B.C. (T) Contents: 1199+ AR. Magnetes: 6 dr. Perrhaebi: 1 dr. (as SNGBerry 547) Thessalian League: 681 double-vict. (as BMC 1-35) 454 dr. (as BMC 36- 42) 18 dr. (as BMC 47-8) 39 triob. (as BMC 44-6) Disposition: Athens as listed. P. Franke has casts of 220 League coins Information from M. Oeconomides Three Thessalian League coins acquired by Athens in 1952 (BCH 1953, p. 194) are probably from this find. Another lot of 33 double-vict. now in the possession of O. Dodson (varieties on record in ANS) would seem to derive from the same hd. It was purchased in 1955 and said to have come from Kozani but this is highly unlikely as Thessalian material rarely turns up in Macedonian hds. See also no. 314 below
